description.raw:
* 3c1d529: the brew ruby command is built-in now, so we don't need to tap homebrew/dev-tools

* b48723d: restore `HOMEBREW_UPDATE_TO_TAG` (revert pull request #538) since brew 1.5.6 has been released

* ee72b4a: homebrew will auto-update before executing certain commands, but this can cause formulae to be out of sync. For example, [this build](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1416/console) failed the `brew doctor` call after `make install`:

~~~
++ brew doctor
Please note that these warnings are just used to help the Homebrew maintainers
with debugging if you file an issue. If everything you use Homebrew for is
working fine: please don't worry or file an issue; just ignore this. Thanks!

Warning: Some installed formulae are missing dependencies.
You should `brew install` the missing dependencies:
  brew install octomap

Run `brew missing` for more details.
~~~

The build script first called `brew install gazebo10 --only-dependencies`, then `brew install python` in order to install an extra pip package. Installing python caused the `fcl` formula to update, which just so happened to include a [new dependency](https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/pull/24684):

~~~
++ brew install python
Updating Homebrew...
==> Auto-updated Homebrew!
Updated 1 tap (homebrew/core).
==> Updated Formulae
fcl

Warning: python 2.7.14_3 is already installed
~~~

This is a pretty rare failure mode, but it is preventable if we don't allow homebrew auto-updates.
description.html:
• 3c1d529: the brew ruby command is built-in now, so we don't need to tap homebrew/dev-tools

  • b48723d: restore HOMEBREW_UPDATE_TO_TAG (revert pull request #538) since brew 1.5.6 has been released

  • ee72b4a: homebrew will auto-update before executing certain commands, but this can cause formulae to be out of sync. For example, this build failed the brew doctor call after make install:

++ brew doctor
Please note that these warnings are just used to help the Homebrew maintainers
with debugging if you file an issue. If everything you use Homebrew for is
working fine: please don't worry or file an issue; just ignore this. Thanks!

Warning: Some installed formulae are missing dependencies.
You should `brew install` the missing dependencies:
  brew install octomap

Run `brew missing` for more details.

The build script first called brew install gazebo10 --only-dependencies, then brew install python in order to install an extra pip package. Installing python caused the fcl formula to update, which just so happened to include a new dependency:

++ brew install python
Updating Homebrew...
==> Auto-updated Homebrew!
Updated 1 tap (homebrew/core).
==> Updated Formulae
fcl

Warning: python 2.7.14_3 is already installed

This is a pretty rare failure mode, but it is preventable if we don't allow homebrew auto-updates.

title.raw: homebrew updates: remove old tap, no auto-update
